column4: Fitch Rates Starbucks' Proposed $500MM Note Issuance 'A'
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  February 01 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned an 'A' rating to  Starbucks Corporation's (Starbucks; NASDAQ: SBUX) proposed $500 million  aggregate issuance of fixed-rate five-year senior unsecured notes. At Dec. 27   2015  Starbucks had approximately $2.3 billion of total debt. A full list of  Starbucks' ratings is provided at the end of this release. The notes will be issued under Starbucks' Aug. 23  2007 indenture and will r

column4: Deals of the day-Mergers and acquisitions
column5: Feb 1 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2100 GMT on Monday:

column4: Abbott Labs to buy diagnostics company Alere for $5.8 billion
column5: Abbott Laboratories  said it would buy Alere Inc  for $5.8 billion to become a leader in point-of-care testing  a fast-growing market as physicians increasingly adopt rapid tests that speed up treatment.

column4: UPDATE 4-Abbott says to buy diagnostic test maker Alere for $5.8 bln
column5: Feb 1 Abbott Laboratories said it would buy Alere Inc for $5.8 billion and become the leader in point-of-care diagnostic testing  a market that is growing as physicians increasingly adopt rapid tests that speed up treatment.

column4: Aetna CEO says Obamacare exchanges need change to be sustainable
column5: Aetna Inc Chief Executive Officer Mark Bertolini said on Monday that he is concerned that the individual healthcare exchanges created under the Affordable Care Act are not sustainable and that recent government proposals for changes are not enough.

column4: Aetna says individual exchange business improved; shares gain
column5: Health insurer Aetna Inc  which is in the process of buying smaller rival Humana Inc  said on Monday its Obamacare insurance business improved at the end of last year  providing a stronger starting point for 2016.

column4: UPDATE 4-Aetna says individual exchange business improved; shares gain

column4: Aetna CEO says Obamacare exchanges need change to be sustainable

column4: Health insurer Aetna profit rises
column5: Feb 1 Health insurer Aetna reported a 38 percent rise in quarterly profit  helped by strong performance in its government business that sells Medicare and Medicaid plans.

column4: Agilent has no standing to appeal patent ruling - Federal Circuit
column5: Acquiring "substantially all" of a company's assets did not give life-sciences equipment giant Agilent Technologies Inc standing to appeal an adverse patent ruling as that company's successor-in-interest  a federal appeals court held Friday.

column4: Alcoa to appoint three new members to board
column5: Aluminum producer Alcoa Inc  said it would appoint three new directors to its board  expanding its size to 15  as the company to prepares to split itself into two later this year.

column4: UPDATE 2-Alcoa to appoint three new members to board
column5: * Elliott Management to support slate of director nominees   (Adds stock movement)

column4: MOVES-High-yield bond manager Sohr leaves AllianceBernstein
column5: NEW YORK  Feb 1 (IFR) - Michael Sohr  a portfolio manager with AllianceBernstein's high-yield team  left last week as part of broader cuts across the asset manager's fixed-income business.

column4: UPDATE 1-Anadarko posts quarterly loss  expects to slash capex 50 percent
